 You are right about immunity, the body has the amazing ability to create memory cells (memory B cells) which can recall a certain virus, thus enabling the body to fight it more effectively and efficiently the next time it sees that virus. Memory B cells are secondary immune-system components that have an affinity for a particular antigen. Like other B cells, memory B cells originate from lymphocytes that develop and are activated in the bone marrow. They become antigen-specific when stimulated by interleukin-4 (IL-4).
